passage.title: He will look like a monkey
passage.paragraph: When Billy is very small, his mother draws pictures for him. She is very bad at drawing, but Billy enjoys her pictures and always wants more.

When Billy is five years old, his mother gives him a small blackboard and some pieces of chalk. One day he is trying to draw a picture of his father. He draws and draws. At last when he looks at his picture, he is not happy.
"Well," he says to his mother. "I'll draw a tail on it, and he will look like a monkey."
